DataElement.preferredName: Axillary Lymph Node Stage Method Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of technique of staging (assessing the extent of a cancer within the body) of axillary lymph nodes from the area of the armpit.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to technique of staging (assing the extent of a cancer within the body) from the area of the armpit.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Lymph nodes found in the armpit that drain the lymph channels from the breast.:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: One of approximately 20-30 lymph nodes in chain formation that traverse the concavity of the underarm to the clavicle.
The extent of a cancer in the body.

Property.preferredDefinition: Scientific or clinical procedures and methods.

Concepts.definition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Axillary Lymph Node Staging Method Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of staging (assessment of extent of cancer) method used in the axillary lymph nodes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else. : Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

Concepts.definition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.

Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

PermissibleValues.value: Sentinel node biopsy followed by surgical evaluation of axilla
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Sentinel node biopsy followed by surgical evaluation of axilla

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Sentinel node biopsy followed by surgical evaluation of axilla
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A staging procedure consisting of sentinel node biopsy followed by surgical evaluation of the axillary lymph nodes.

Concepts.longName: Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy Followed by Axillary Lymph Node Biopsy
Concepts.definition: A staging procedure consisting of sentinel node biopsy followed by surgical evaluation of the axillary lymph nodes.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

PermissibleValues.value: Surgical evaluation of the axilla without prior sentinel node biopsy
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Surgical evaluation of the axilla without prior sentinel node biopsy

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Surgical evaluation of the axilla without prior sentinel node biopsy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Axilla; the hollow under the arm where it is joined to the shoulder.: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.: Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone. (from Merriam-Webster OnLine): Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

Concepts.definition: The underside concavity where the arm and the shoulder are joined.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.
Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.

Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

PermissibleValues.value: Sentinel node biopsy followed by axillary dissection or sampling with a minimum total of 6 axillary nodes if any of the following are present
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Sentinel node biopsy followed by axillary dissection or sampling with a minimum total of 6 axillary nodes if any of the following are present

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Sentinel node biopsy followed by axillary dissection or sampling with a minimum total of 6 axillary nodes if any of the following are present
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lymph node dissection of at least 6 axillary lymph nodes.: A staging procedure consisting of sentinel node biopsy followed by surgical evaluation of the axillary lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: Lymph node dissection of at least 6 axillary lymph nodes.

Concepts.longName: Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy Followed by Axillary Lymph Node Biopsy
Concepts.definition: A staging procedure consisting of sentinel node biopsy followed by surgical evaluation of the axillary lymph nodes.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

PermissibleValues.value: Sentinel node biopsy alone or followed by axillary node dissection, for clinically negative node patients as described below
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Sentinel node biopsy alone or followed by axillary node dissection, for clinically negative node patients as described below

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Sentinel node biopsy alone or followed by axillary node dissection, for clinically negative node patients as described below
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A staging procedure consisting of sentinel node biopsy followed by surgical evaluation of the axillary lymph nodes.: Cancer that has not spread to the lymph nodes.: Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

Concepts.definition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

Concepts.longName: Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy Followed by Axillary Lymph Node Biopsy
Concepts.definition: A staging procedure consisting of sentinel node biopsy followed by surgical evaluation of the axillary lymph nodes.
A clinical finding that a lymph node is free from cancer spread.

Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else. : Surgical removal of the lymph nodes located in the cavity beneath the junction of the arm and the thorax, or axilla (armpit).  This procedure is commonly performed as a component of cancer staging.

Concepts.definition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.
Surgical removal of the lymph nodes located in the cavity beneath the junction of the arm and the thorax, or axilla (armpit).  This procedure is commonly performed as a component of cancer staging.

PermissibleValues.value: Sentinel lymph node biopsy plus axillary dissection
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Sentinel lymph node biopsy plus axillary dissection

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Sentinel lymph node biopsy plus axillary dissection
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure in which the sentinel node is removed followed by dissection and removal of the axillary node group.

Concepts.longName: Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy with Axillary Lymph Node Dissection
Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure in which the sentinel node is removed followed by dissection and removal of the axillary node group.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of approximately 20-30 lymph nodes in chain formation that traverse the concavity of the underarm to the clavicle. : An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The process of defining at what point in the natural history of a malignant disease a patient is when a diagnosis is made.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

This procedure is commonly performed as a component of cancer staging.
